name: Raleigh Marriott Crabtree Valley

reviews.text: Overall the property was clean, well kept and offered free (self) parking. It's located directly across from the Crabtree Valley Mall. Be forewarned it is a business highway and not easy to cross. I attempted one evening to eat at the restaurant - before 7PM - but was redirected to the bar. The restaurant was closed. This was perplexing as the evening meal was advertised, plus the hotel was quite full during my stay. I inquired again, hoping for some explanation, but none was offered. The bar menu was limited; the meal ample and tasty. Room service is an option, too. In the age of ubiquitous internet, this hotel charges for in-room (Ethernet) internet service. Marriott’s Springfield Suites, their budget hotel line, provides free in-room (Ethernet) internet service. The hotel may offer free Wi-Fi, but I neither tried nor needed it. The staff was friendly but did not stand out when compared to comparable hotels. So, overall, an acceptable hotel, but next time I travel to the area I’ll try another hotel.
reviews.title: Convenient location, but did not leave me wanting to come back.

reviews.text: Not sure if i want to come here for my next vacation, but this Hotel is very nice. I come here for work so I think its great for a "Business stay".
reviews.title: NIce Hotel. :-)

reviews.text: The Hotel is very clean. Nice rooms, nice restaurant, and GREAT people. Everybody is very nice, but that may be the Southern Charm. :-)
reviews.title: outstanding service make this one of my favorite hotels

reviews.text: Location: Did I mention is located right across the Mall? Yes.
reviews.title: Not Overwhelmed

reviews.text: The only bad thing is that they don't have WIRELESS INTERNET... :-(
reviews.title: Good Location. Comfortable Bed

reviews.text: This hotel has been around since the late 80s and has just finished a much needed upgrade throughout. I am a Marriott Platinum Member and stay equal time at Sheratons so I am on the road the majority of the year. I really like this hotel however my company has implemented a policy that they will not pay for Internet at hotels. Basically if you want to stay at a hotel that charges internet it is on your dime. I do not consider myself cheap but I agree with my company policy and altough I have stayed at this hotel they, like most mariotts, charge for internet on a daily basis. Great hotel and unfortunitly I will have to stay at the new Residence Inn Across the street from here on out. CIAO Marriotts! One last note; if you stay at this hotel there is a spectacular hidden Gem called Umstead State park 3 miles up the street. Adter a hard Day at Work this place is a serene sancuary with minimally difficult, but very well maintained, trails.
reviews.title: Good overall Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Influenced by the lower price than the other top tier Marriotts in town, we booked a short get-away stay at the Crabtree Marriott. We requested a renovated room (don't know if they are all renovated or not)...and found a plush, comfortable bed with modern spa-like bathroom w/granite countertop and cool square shaped sink and faucet. Bed was comfortable..big, soft, lots of pillows and nice sheets and comforter.
reviews.title: Surprisingly Updated

reviews.text: As gold members we were offered free breakfast in the restaurant since the lounge was closed for the weekend. It was very nice and a pleasant surprise. PF Chang's across the street was a great dinner spot!
reviews.title: Just Dandy For A Business Trip

reviews.text: Had a two day trip during the week. Hotel shuttle picked me up at the airport (wait was over 1/2 hour for the shuttle). The check-in was quick and the front desk was helpful. Room was clean and adorned in an updated fashion, including a nice tv. I was at a conference at the hotel and had hotel meals as part of the conference. Food was ok, nothing to special, but good enough. Used the pool and fitness areas, those were fine as well. Overall, this is exactly what I've come to expect with business travel places, and I think that is exactly what this location strives to be. If I had to go back, I wouldn't hesitate to book here again. I did have one minor complaint...the internet in the room and hotel (excluding the lobby), wasn't free. For the amount I paid, I would have expected this to be included, especially since this location caters to people working while away.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in a city that doesn't have many

reviews.text: I have stayed here on four occasions for business. The hotel is a good location in that it is only 20 minutes from airport, 10 minutes from downtown, and directly across from a major mall. Marriott hotels seem to be all over the board in quality. This one is on the better side and typically around $140 per night. Matress is comfortable, linens are nothing spectacular, bathroom is smaller/older. All seemed very clean. Nice flat screen TV.
reviews.title: It's good but they will nickle & dime you.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Marriott Crabtree is an clean and well-located hotel for the Raleigh area. We took advantage of the free airport-hotel shuttle (although we did have to wait 30minutes, but no problem).
reviews.title: Marriott continues to please

reviews.text: Check in was simple, and the room was clean and maid service was prompt. People at the hotel were friendly, and it's location right across the street from the Crabtree Mall offered lots of dining choices - Cheesecake factory, PF Chang's, etc.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay in Raleigh

reviews.text: Pool was clean and attractive. It wasn't very busy the weekend we were there, which made the service that more attentive.
reviews.title: Very Pleased

reviews.text: FYI, if you need a taxi in Raleigh, call for it. Unless you're at the hotel, you won't find one rolling around the streets to hail.
reviews.title: A bit disppointing

likes.liked: — Bath & Body Works shampoo, conditioner, lotion provided
likes.disliked: — parking situation...parking FAR away from building...in the pouring rain!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Crabtree Marriott for two nights with our grandchildren. The hotel staff was exceptionally accommodating. The breakfast buffet was excellent. The room was clean and had a beautiful view of the garden area. Both the indoor and outdoor pools were great fun, and the bathrooms were clean. The reception area had complementary drinks and goodies for the children. We enjoyed our stay and will return again when we visit the grandchildren in Raleigh.
reviews.title: Disappointing Stay in Raleigh

reviews.text: Do not stay at this hotel. There is a much better choice about a mile away: The brand new, cool North Hills Marriott Renaissance.
reviews.title: There is a much better option a mile away. This hotel has issues.

reviews.text: The Crabtree Marriott has seen better days. My room's carpet had large stains. The hotel is very dated. It's located high on a hill. The parking lot is at the bottom of the hill. You will hike every time you come or go. The Ren has new rooms and the covered parking is the easiest of any Marriott hotel I've been to. (I'm Platinum and have been to hundreds of Marriotts.)
reviews.title: Loved the Hotel!!!

likes.liked: — Cleanliness of the Rooms and proximity to mall.
likes.disliked: — No microwave or refridgerator in room.

reviews.text: The Marriott is across a highway from a mall, but you cannot walk there easilty. The Ren is in a pedestrian friendly new shopping district with every type of dining you could want just steps from the hotel.
reviews.title: Nice Stay, Bad Locale

reviews.text: The service at the old, worn Marriott is horrid. A complete stranger was charged for my room. It took two months - over 20 calls - to straighten this out. During that time, the hotel staff lied, lied, and lied. One should be able to get charged for a room and get an honest copy of the bill. Apparently, that is not the case at this hotel. Avoid the issue by avoiding the hotel.
reviews.title: This is an awesome hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On an earlier stay, my reservation guaranteed a King Room. When I checked in, the jerk at the desk went out of his way to tell me there were no King Rooms - he brought it up seemingly out of the blue - but that my reservation didn't guaranty me a King Room. He continued to argue and was very, very rude. I showed him my reservation, which clearly guaranteed the King Room, and suddenly there was one available. How many lies did he tell in a short period of time? At least four. Which seems par for the course at this dated, worn hotel.
reviews.title: Marriott quality!

description: This hotel near Raleigh Durham International Airport offers 375 rooms for business or leisure guests. Meeting planners find it easy to use the various meeting rooms for special events and weddings.
